concept.title: Summary
concept.shortdesc: Anytime you break out from the simple subject-verb-object (SVO) order, you raise your chances of having an ambiguity.

conbody.p: You can avoid most ambiguities by:

ul.li: Watching how you use polysemic words

conbody.p: When you must have more complex sentences remember that we read left-to-right and keep related words and phrases close together if you are referring between them.
